feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 1:23AM AKST until January 12 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills ranging 40 to 55 below are occurring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 2:57PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...MODERATE RAINFALL AND GUSTY CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND... A low pressure is paired with a long fetch of moisture that will stream moderate amounts of precipitation starting as early as Thursday. Precipitation type is expected to be mostly rain, with possible mixing overnight in the central and northern locations.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 2:57PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOWFALL EXPECTED THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND... A plume of moisture entering the panhandle Thursday is expected to bring widespread precipitation into the weekend. Temperatures are forecasted to remain near freezing along the roads, resulting in accumulating snowfall. This multiday system may accumulate up to a foot of snow along the road systems, 2 to 6 inches near Haines
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 12 at 8:20AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A FLASH FLOOD WATCH HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR AMERICAN SAMOA... The South Pacific Convergence Zone (SPCZ) will move across the islands Thursday through at least Friday. This will increase the potential for flash flooding across the territory. This will be the final Hydrologic Outlook issued for this event. Additional hydrologic threat information will be covered by the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT... WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible WHERE...All islands of American Samoa WHEN...Through Friday Night IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may cause flooding on roadways and properties and overflowing of streams. Landslides are also
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 1:55AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 11 to 13 feet will impact all shores of American Samoa, mainly north and west shores. * TIMING...through this morning. * IMPACTS...High surfs and strong rip currents. Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued January 12 at 10:50AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AN AIR QUALITY ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED BY THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY... Due to elevated pollutant levels, the air quality is forecast to become unhealthy for sensitive groups in Franklin County, including the city of Preston among other. This advisory will remain in effect until air quality has significantly improved.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 7:40AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER IMPACTS LIKELY THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY... A low pressure system moving down from Canada will likely bring impactful winter weather to much of western and central North Dakota Thursday evening through Friday. Moderate to heavy snow could fall from south central through north central North Dakota.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 2:31AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Thursday Night and Friday Heavy Snow Potential... A clipper system will bring the region potentially significant snowfall accumulations from Thursday night through Friday afternoon. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:31AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAINFALL ENDING TODAY WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASED THREAT OF LANDSLIDES IN WESTERN WASHINGTON THROUGH SATURDAY... Heavy precipitation over the past few days and weeks has increased soil moisture to saturated levels across Western Washington. Rainfall totals Tuesday were in the 1 to 3 inch range in the lowlands with as much as 7 inches in the Olympics. Another
